reviews.review_msg: Havens flip flops more than John Kerry. If you ask him how he grades an assignment, get it in writing, because its likely he'll forget what he said to you. Also, he's an american who wants to be a canadian.

Letter grades are out but we haven't gotten back 80% of our marks. I did very well but some others failed and have no clue why. Students have a right to know how their letter grades were determined. It should be against a university policy to withhold marks like that. Don't take a course with this prof.

9 lectures in 13 weeks. Seems to make up the syllabus on the fly. We hardly did anything until the end of the semester. Suddenly within the few last weeks we're overloaded with assignments and quizzes. Grade weights seem almost random; 5 standard questions worth 14% while a project worth 20%. Yes, these are tough times, but this is unacceptable.

lectures are clear and he is super helpful and accessible. My only issue was with organization. We got term project requirements later than I would have liked (like 2 weeks before due date), and the project was worth a LOT of our grade. We expected to have 4 assignments, but only had 2. Other than the disorganization it was totally fine!
Sometimes questions were unclear for the homework, but in general he was generous with grading and the examinations were relevant to the material.
He taight the lecture well, very considerate and patient to each student, and we learned a lot from his classes.

Lectures were a bit dry but conveyed the material clearly. Assignments, quizzes, and exams were well-designed, instructive, and fair. The professor gave good feedback and was accessible outside of class.
The class consists of interesting topics and projects. Although the midterm had been move to the final, all the stuff had been tested from lecture notes. Have a good experience learning with him.
The topic is interesting, but really hard to learn by myself. The uncertainty before the final exam is large.
He should be a perfect research prof but really needs to learn how to teach.

Hang is a respected professor. He gives excellent feedbacks for our presentation and the final report. You will definitely learn something from him if you spend enough time for his slides or lectures.

The exam is all based on his lectures, you will be good if you study for all his slides. His assignment is very interesting. assignment description is very clear. He is the best professor in SFU CMPT courses!!!:)
The class is totally just reading the PowerPoint, and he did not even give an example, the worst thing is that the class is all recordings no interaction at all!!!!!!

None of the slides are from the same source, so notation/format changes from slide to slide. Often they have little to no information on them. Or just repeat information. Absolutely no idea what he was talking about most of the time. I could genuinely feel the lack of effort/care put into teaching this.

His slides are taken from his academic collaborators from other universities, and so is the homework and exam. The assignment was a single project, which was marked generously. The mandatory group project asked us to extend and improve the assignment solution based on his own research results. So he's very knowledgeable about the topic.
